libai.nn.supervised
Class RBF

java.lang.Object
  libai.nn.NeuralNetwork
      libai.nn.supervised.Perceptron
          libai.nn.supervised.Adaline
              libai.nn.supervised.RBF
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class RBF
extends Adaline

Radial Basis Function or RBF. Is an hybrid neural network with 3 layers (1-input, 1-hidden, 1-output). The hidden layers is trained using a stochactic clustering algorithm: k-means. The final layer is trained using the Adaline rule. The k-means algorithm is used to set up the position of the "centers" of the radial basis functions, as this process is regardless of the output and invariant over the input, could be used a highly efficient algorithm. This implementation uses only Gaussian functions as radial basis functions.

Author:
kronenthaler
See Also:

Constructor Detail

RBF

public RBF()

RBF

public RBF(int[] nperlayer)
Constructor. Receives an array with the information of the number of neurons per layer. Layer[0] is the input layer. Layer[1] is the hidden layer and represents the number radial functions to use. layer[2] is the output layer.

Parameters:
nperlayer - Neurons Per Layer.
Method Detail

train

public void train(Matrix[] patterns,
                  Matrix[] answers,
                  double alpha,
                  int epochs,
                  int offset,
                  int length,
                  double minerror)
Train the network using a hybrid scheme. First set the centers of the radial basis functions using k-means algorithm. After that the radius of the function is calculated using n-nearest neighbors. When n = the number of inputs. Then the output for the hidden layer are precalculated and used as input for the Adaline trainning.

Overrides:
train in class Adaline
Parameters:
patterns - The patterns to be learned.
answers - The expected answers.
alpha - The learning rate.
epochs - The maximum number of iterations
offset - The first pattern position
length - How many patterns will be used.
minerror - The minimal error expected.
